name: flynn
text: I keep toggling my brightness and contrast up and down and as near as I can tell they are driving through some kind of totemic nightmare world.

name: gompo
text: A comment left by gompo was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Hipjiverobot, Mangtastic, mortshire, _cheesekayke, TheLoneliestMonkey, ravindra108, danielaroo)

name: money4something
text: It's an Escalade, fool!

name: dusty
text: I kinda thought it was a recently slept on pillow. The only reason I can think of for this establishing and closing shot is to show that they are on a narrow mountain road going into a tunnel, the first to symbolize a path on which one cannot turn around and the second a transition with an unclear view of what lies ahead. Ray's escalade is like Calvin's sled.

name: chaesar
text: It's good, the mountainside looks like shrink-wrapped scallops.

name: mortshire
text: I-I-I saw a nightmarish mangled pig face.

name: achilleselbow
text: A comment left by achilleselbow was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by straw, gorrioncita, unsentletter)

name: scorpio_nadir
text: Those......are....Roast Beef's......anxieties.

name: theplaidknight
text: Dead breasts gets chubbies and the comment above this one doesn't?  For Shame.

name: 7a65726f
text:
Is that what that is?
I thought it was a silhouette cast upon a tent's side, featuring a violent brawl between a shoe, a rooster, and an oyster made of hands.

name: i_love_kate
text:
I saw a prehistoric rabbit, possibly mutated, fighting a tiki diety, personally. In the background, a triffid watches. Perhaps it is touching itself.

These are just examples. It could also be something much better.

name: zathyr
text: I see the angry rabbit, but I think it is more stylized than prehistoric.  And it is fighting a dog what has raised a paw to defend itself from the rabbit's attack but it does not see the elephant sneaking up behind it.

name: dtuba
text: Whatever it is you are smoking, I want some.

name: hollis
text: Roast Beef looks out for Molly in his own way.

name: deancain29
text: A comment left by deancain29 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by featurelessvoid, twohundredninety, ajg, equinn2006, sneechles, ASaltySalute4, Darthemed)

name: twohundredninety
text:
Rate strips relative to each other! The rating system isn't there to prove how much everyone here loves Achewood.

It's there so the strips can be ranked from most to least popular, and that works better if the entire scale is used. If you like a strip but still think it's worse than most of the archive, you should give it a low score.

name: twohundredninety
text: um also maybe you just made a joke and now I look like an idiot. THIS IS POSSIBLE

name: deancain29
text: yes i was joking. a chubbie for your magnaminity

name: stereo
text: Ratings of 1 are reserved for guest strips, in the main.  Just to remind people that there can only be one authist here.

name: zedpower
text: Hot shovels are useless. You'd maybe think they can soften up some types of soil or something but that's actually rather ineffective and takes too long besides.

name: deusoma
text: be great for snow-covered driveways though.

name: greenkoolayd
text: i thought he meant 'hot' as in, stolen...

name: tttt
text: panel three looks like they're being carried away by robots

name: stuart
text: Those are some rude seats.

name: aarongstock
text: Perhaps only one of them has that shamrock that covers the guy's penis.

name: ezcmac
text: Ray drives like it's on autopilot.

name: epicurus
text:
I'm not going to say that Chris Onstad is bad at drawing the background during night (or hell) driving scenes, but he definitely produces some effects which were probably not intended.

Like that one where the rock face was a morbidly obese man's nipples.

Chris: if you meant to draw a towering fat man's boobies in the background please email me.

name: bourbonsamurai
text: What do you need to say to him about that?

name: tekende
text: Presumably, not to do it again.

name: epicurus
text: If you only knew...

name: waddlerz
text: I could definetely see Onstad as a sox fan

name: fuzzyshoo
text:
This strip was posted on the day of Game 7 of the 2004 ALCS, where the Boston Red Sox rallied to beat the New York Yankees for the American League title.

They went on to sweep the St. Louis Cardinals in 4 games and win their first World Series title in 86 years.

http://mlb.mlb.com/bos/history/championship04.jsp

name: rowboat
text: You forgot to mention how much it sucked.

name: fineoakstructure
text: oh jesus the Cards won in 2006 what are you cryin about

name: rowboat
text: But we didn't win that one.

name: fineoakstructure
text: you startin to sound like a yankees fan

name: rowboat
text: you startin to sound like a reds fan

name: fineoakstructure
text: SCREW YOU MAN WE CATCHING UP

name: rowboat
text:
yeah catchin up to the pirates maybe

ooh daaaaaamn

name: fineoakstructure
text: r e d l e g s

name: rowboat
text: A lot has happened since this thread began. I'll give you that. But we all know how this is going to end.

name: fineoakstructure
text: Let me have my fun.

name: fineoakstructure
text: Vote for Votto

name: rowboat
text: Get his Canuck ass behind the plate and I might.

name: rowboat
text: OK. It's two ugly, ugly months later and I'm here to man up and admit defeat. Have fun watching some October ball for once. Kick some Yankee ass if you get that far. In the meantime, I'm adopting the Braves for the rest of the season.

name: fineoakstructure
text: It ain't over 'til etc. etc.  The Reds ain't exactly lightin' it up over the past week.

name: rowboat
text: You obviously haven't been watching the Cardinals. The vultures are circling. And thickly.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Nice Pete: Chapter 9: The Moaning Hole

name: bixschmix
text:
The cat named Cassandra is afraid of commitment, but he is more afraid of his girl being cheated by an unscrupulous landlord. That's love!

God damn his expression in panel 5 is so genuine and emotive.

name: jezebel
text: I like how this is the first situation that comes to his mind.  Not Molly being homeless, or in danger by herself, or lonely and sad.  No.  Beef is first worried about her being quoted false terms on a new rental.

name: pogo
text: This is one of those days when I've had enough of Beef's purile whining and paranoid musings.  VROOOM indeed.

name: woodenteeth
text: I do like the fact that as thematic punctuation, Onstad put in the last panel. Beef all entering a "dark tunnel".

name: intergalactic_
text: I'm sure Ray plots all of his routes to include driving through tunnels. Jus' sayin'.

name: ghost_story
text: who else sees the evil 3-eared lobsterabbit in the mountainside detail

name: johnnybaverage
text: Me (I do).(I wish I didn't).
